title: Rotational kinetic energy - rods and spheres

content.question: A device consists of two rods of negligible mass with a sphere of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> connected to one end of each rod. Each rod is free to rotate independently about a shared axis. At the instant shown in the figure, the left rod is rotating clockwise and the right rod is rotating counterclockwise, and each sphere has speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and is moving toward the top of the page. The sum of the translational kinetic energy of the two spheres is <math alttext="K sub translational" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>trans</mi></msub></math>. The total rotational kinetic energy of the spheres-and-rods system is <math alttext="K sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>sys</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="K sub translational" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>trans</mi></msub></math> to <math alttext="K sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>sys</mi></msub></math> ?
